name: Le Meridien Arlington

reviews.text: I just stayed at Le Meridien for 4 nights in the beginning of June, while traveling for business. This is a beautiful hotel - clean and elegant. It has a pleasant spa-like aroma so you instantly feel calmed upon entering it. It's centrally located to Georgetown, the Metro, businesses, food trucks for weekday lunch, bike trails, etc. There's a 24-hour gym, which I should have used more. I only experienced the restaurant, Amuse, in the morning for a light and healthy continental breakfast. In the evening, from 5-6pm, they offer a wine hour that is nice for networking. The staff was incredibly helpful and responsive, particularly Acey and Mohammed, who offered stellar customer service. The next time I'm in DC/VA for business, I will return!
reviews.title: Clean and elegant - perfect for the business traveler

reviews.text: The Le Meridien, now a Starwood hotel, was the Palomar last year when we stayed there. However, the hotel still seems to be the same great place to stay in the Arlington/Georgetown area.
reviews.title: New Owners, But Still a Great Place to Stay

reviews.text: Our favorite feature of this hotel is its location, which is super convenient, and the hotel is relatively inexpensive for a long weekend trip to the DC area. Here are the particulars:
reviews.title: Regular Guest

reviews.text: 1) The Rosslyn Metro station is about one and one-half blocks away. And believe me, the Metro is the only way you should be thinking about local travel in the DC area.
reviews.title: Recurring Business Trip

reviews.text: 2) Valet parking is available, but you can self park in the hotel's well-lighted connected parking garage. We arrived on a Friday afternoon, and left early Monday morning, and the self-parking bill was $34. Again, great for clean, indoor parking in the DC area.
reviews.title: Beautiful Hotel!

reviews.text: The Le Meridien in Arlington does a good job as an understated and modern hotel. It shares the building with a condominium, whose residents also use the hotel's gym - and parking. The rooms are small in the hotel, but well done. The bathroom was adequate, but not finished as nicely as the rest of the room (small cosmetic details such as cheap looking tile). Rooms are quiet and the staff is professional. The parking garage is also used by the condo and apparently also for monthly parkers working in the area. As the lot was full when I came back during an afternoon I had to valet park, which is more expensive. Also, while having a nice gym for a hotel no towels were offered - which raises some ick factor on the equipment. Overall, a good value for the money.
reviews.title: Very solid hotel

reviews.text: I was upgraded to a suite once and it was amazing - I wish I was able to take advantage of the HUGE jacuzzi at the time. But even the regular rooms are great. Nicely designed and great views of Georgetown and the Potomac. Breakfast is just right. There are plenty of places to eat in Rosslyn/Courthouse area nearby and Georgetown is just a hop across the bridge. Plenty of places to park later at night and easy access to major highways as well as the Rosslyn Metro. Make sure you check out Chopt - I am sold on those salad creations joints! There was one night where I was awakened by loud voices coming from the vent in the bathroom - must've been from an adjoining room. Didn't last long, and not that big a deal. Front desk is very helpful.
reviews.title: beautiful

reviews.text: As a former Kimpton hotel, Le Meridien has maintained the pet-friendly status that they had before. No deposits and no weight limits. This was great because we were in town for a wedding and needed to bring our two large dogs. The hotel's lobby is several floors up and then the elevators are split between the hotel and condominiums. The rooms are upscale - stylish, upscale, simple and comfortable. There are parks close by to walk dogs. I recommend this place, even if you don't have a dog.
reviews.title: Pet-friendly hotel!

reviews.text: WOW! I cannot say enough about the EXCEPTIONAL service we received during our 3 night stay at Le Meridien in Arlington. Our suite was beautiful (fabulous tub, great shower, wonderful layout, super clean). The hotel is only a block away from The Metro and a quick ride by taxi or limo into DC. Those would have made it a great trip - but the exceptional service made the stay one of our best trips ever. The staff was friendly, outgoing, helpful and caring - - from the staff at the front desk, to housekeeping to bell services. No one was too busy to answer questions and go the extra mile (and traveling with a 12 year old on this trip presented some special needs for us!). A special thank you to Bill who went out of his way to make sure our trip was the best it could be.... for going all the way to the bottom level of the parking garage to retrieve our luggage when we arrived before check-in, for securing our transportation for us several times, for answering our multitude of questions and even helping me find a local McDonalds when my 12 year old tired of "hotel food" (which was GREAT)... THANK YOU!!! This is a fabulous hotel with the best staff. When we come back to DC in the fall - it is a GIVEN that we will stay at Le Meridien in Arlington! Thank you for a great experience!
reviews.title: EXCEPTIONAL Service!!! Beautiful Room!!!

reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights at the Le Meridien Hotel in Arlington, VA and it was a great experience. The entire staff was accomodating and professional and made us feel welcomed. In addition, the rooms were clean and relaxing, we had a beautiful view of Gerogetown, plus the wine hour and eco option for a $10 breakfast voucher were awesome. I even got a little ill and and an executiev town car with a very nice and curtious driver was available to take me to CVS to pick up my prescription. This is a very nice hotel located in such a prime location of the rail system, dining, shopping etc. Whenever I'm in town I wil always stay at the Le Meridian and recommend that others visiting the area do the same.
reviews.title: Great Experience!

reviews.text: The hotel is close to Georgetown, a good 10 to 15 minute walk the bridge and you will be in Georgetown area. The hotel lighting is very relaxing, the lobby, the hallways and the room has a very calm feel. The room is very clean, spot free! very friendly staff at the front desk.

description: Centrally located among top destinations in the Washington, D.C. region, Le Méridien Arlington is a stylish boutique hotel close to numerous restaurants and shopping options for our guests. We are excited to announce our new, contemporary chic style restaurant and lounge coming this March! Between the dates of January 13th to March 14th we will have our formal restaurant and lounge closed to carry out some beautiful refinements in the name of Méridien! We do not anticipate any disruption to services as the hotel has taken alternative measures to provide you a great experience.
